1. The percentages are aggregated across all the University programmes which accept A-Level qualifications within each academic  cluster.
2. No GES data is shown as we have yet to graduate our first batch of graduates from this programme.
3. There is only one set of GES figures for the Food Business Management (FBM) programme, with no separation by specialisations .
4. The Graduate Employment Survey (GES) 2023 results were for 3 separate programmes before they were merged (with effect from A Y2022 intake):
Bachelor of Engineering with Honours in Marine Engineering: 90.6%, $4,200Bachelor of Engineering with Honours in Naval Architecture: 94.4%, $4,450Bachelor of Enginnering with Honours in Offshore Engineering: 86.4%, $4,200SIT Indicative Grade Profile 2024
